alert.note: Alert for Benton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 5:50PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Benton County through 615 PM CDT... At 550 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Van Horne, or 7 miles south of Vinton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Vinton around 610 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Urbana. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 43 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
